description:
I was hoping for a quick command-line argument to run periodically, but this is trash. Showed 32ms Ping and 300mbps down.

Open a browswer got 9ms Ping and 950mbps down. 

Bottlenecked by janky implementation or server location selection. I dunno.

Uninstalled immediately.
Works as described: one line internet speed test.

This snap didn't work well for me; the website returned faster results, so there's something off with this snap.

Removed this, went to speedtest.net, found the direct instruction for the CLI installation. Had to modify the last step from "sudo apt-get install speedtest" to "sudo apt-get install speedtest-cli" (the instructions need a slight update...) but the install otherwise went perfectly and the app from that source works perfecty.
N' apparaît pas dans la liste des applications une fois installé sur Ubuntu 20.04 LTS. N' a pas pu tester.

Hé oui elle n'aparait pas dans la liste des applications, il faut aller dans le terminal et taper speed-test. On a alors le ping et les vitesses up and down sur le terminal....déroutant pour les novices dont je fais partie !
summary: Fonctionne bien mais il faut savoir l'utiliser !
